{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents mention several times that heparin is administered subcutaneously for post-operative thromboprophylaxis. For example, Document [1] talks about heparin administered at twelve- and eight-hour intervals, which is typically done subcutaneously. Document [2] also mentions subcutaneous administration of low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) for patients with moderate and increased risk levels. Document [14] also mentions subcutaneous administration of LMWH.
